<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />I, Paul, am writing this letter. Sosthenes, our fellow believer, is with me as I write it. God appointed me to be an apostle of Christ Jesus, and God chose me to serve him. 

  <verse number="2" style="v" />This letter is to the church of God in Corinth, to those whom Christ Jesus has apart for God, with everyone else—everwhere—who calls on God to save them in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, their Lord and ours.  </para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="3" style="v" />May God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ love you and give you peace.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="4" style="v" />I thank my God every day for you, because of the many costly gifts that Christ Jesus has given to you because he loves you. 

  <verse number="5" style="v" />Christ has given you so many things. He helped you to speak his truth and to know God.

  <verse number="6" style="v" />You yourselves stood by these statements as true, as you have spoken about Christ.</para>

<verse number="7" style="v" />I pray for you that you would not have lack any gift from the Spirit of God while you wait for the day when God will make the Lord Jesus Christ known and will show him to everyone. 

<verse number="8" style="v" />God will also make you strong so you can serve him to the very end, so you will bring no shame upon yourselves on the day that our Lord Jesus Christ returns to earth.

<verse number="9" style="v" />God will keep his promise to do that. God called you, so you can know and love his Son, Jesus Christ, who is our Lord.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="10" style="v" />Brothers and sisters, I beg you by the authority of Jesus, that you come to an agreement and that you settle this argument, and that there be no more divisions among you. Learn to see things from the same point of view as you work to settle this argument and then you will find that you have the same goals in mind. 

  <verse number="11" style="v" />Those in Chloe's house reported to me that there had been divisions and disagreements among some of you. </para>

<verse number="12" style="v" />This is the problem. Each of you claims to have loyalty to one leader or another. One says, "I am loyal to Paul." Another says, "I am loyal to Apollos."  Someone else says, "I am loyal to Peter." And the last one says, "But I am loyal to Christ." 

<verse number="13" style="v" />But Christ does not divide his loyalty. Paul was not crucified for you. The person who baptized you did not baptize you in the name of Paul.

<verse number="14" style="v" />I thank God that I baptized only a few people there, among them was I baptized Crispus and Gaius. 

<verse number="15" style="v" />It would not be true that  I baptized them in my name. 

<verse number="16" style="v" />(Now I remember that I also baptized the household of Stephanas, but other than those people, I do not remember baptizing anyone else in Corinth.)

<verse number="17" style="v" />The most important reason Christ sent me was not to baptize people but to tell everyone the Good News about him. I proclaimed the Good News not so it was established by human wisdom and with the use of clever words, but so that the message is built on the foundation of the work of Christ when he died on the cross.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="18" style="v" />For those who are dead to the things of God, they cannot know him, the message about Christ dying on the cross is pointless to them. But for those of us whom God has rescued and brought to life, we know it is God's power working in us. 

  <verse number="19" style="v" />A prophet wrote in the Scriptures: </para>

<para style="p"></para>

<para style="q1">"The wisdom of those who think they are wise, </para>

<para style="q1">I will destroy,</para>

<para style="q1">and I will make the brilliant plans of the intelligent </para>

<para style="q1">to be utter failures."</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="20" style="v" />Where are the wise people of this world? They did not understand anything  about God. Neither do the scholars, nor those skilled in debate. For God has shown that all their wisdom is foolishness.

  <verse number="21" style="v" />In the wisdom of God,  unbelievers did not come to know God by their own wisdom. So God was pleased to use a message that they thought was foolish, that is message we proclaimed and it had power to save all who believe it.</para>

<verse number="22" style="v" />The Jews wanted public displays of miraculous power before they would follow anyone. The Greeks are looking for wisdom through new and fresh ways of thinking about spiritual ideas.

<verse number="23" style="v" />But we proclaim a message about Christ, who died on a cross. For the Jews this message about the cross of Christ is something they cannot receive because death on a cross brings a curse with it. To the Greeks it is too foolish to deserve their attention.

<verse number="24" style="v" />But for us, we whom God called so we can know him, Christ is his power to rescue from destruction and it is the wisdom to know God and to learn about him. The good news is not tied to any race or philosophy, in Christ there is no distinction between Jews and all the other nations and races on earth.

<verse number="25" style="v" />Because what appears foolish to God is wiser that the most brilliant ideas human beings can imagine. And the weakest part of God's nature is stronger than the strongest and greatest human being who ever lived.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="26" style="v" />Brothers and sisters, look at the kind of person you were when God called you. See how unimportant you were. You were not the wisest of people. You were not important enough for people to obey you. You had no important ancestors.   

  <verse number="27" style="v" />Instead, God chose the things that made no sense to unbelievers, in order to stop them from praising themselves. God chose to use things that were weak, to put to shame the things they believed were so strong.</para>

<verse number="28" style="v" />God chose what the unbelievers think is of no importance in order to show that the things they consider to be important, have no value. 

<verse number="29" style="v" />God did this so that no human being could have any reason to praise himself and he should offer God all praise instead.

<verse number="30" style="v" />Because of what God has done, you are now joined to Christ Jesus, who has made clear to us how wise God is, he has put us right with God, he has set us apart for God, and he has rescued us and brought us to safety.

<verse number="31" style="v" />So, as the Scriptures say: 

<para style="q1">"The one who praises himself should praise himself only in what the Lord has done for him."</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />When I came to you, brothers and sisters, I did not make beautiful speeches, nor did I repeat to you the things that wise men said. I told you the hidden truths about God.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />I decided not to talk to you about anything other than Jesus Christ and his death on the cross. </para>

<verse number="3" style="v" />When I was with you, you know how physically weak I was. You know that fear filled my heart, and that you saw me trembling in terror because of my enemies.

<verse number="4" style="v" />But you heard my message, and you know that when I spoke to you I did not give carefully planned speeches. Instead, the Spirit of God showed you that I was speaking the truth because of the power of the miracles he did through me. 

<verse number="5" style="v" />I taught this way so you might trust in God because of his power, and not because of anything having to do with human wisdom.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="6" style="v" />Now we speak to those who trust in Christ like those who have grown up in their faith. But you now have wisdom and it has nothing to do with the kings and governors who are in this life, but they are all soon to pass away.

  <verse number="7" style="v" />We proclaim wisdom that God had kept hidden until now, for God made these wise decisions before he created the world, and he did this in order to honor us.</para>

<verse number="8" style="v" />None of those who rule this world knew about God's wise plans. If they had understood them, they never would have nailed the Lord to the cross, but they should have honored Christ instead. 

<verse number="9" style="v" />But in the Scriptures it says:

<para style="q1">"Things that no one has seen,</para>

<para style="q1">no one has heard,</para>

<para style="q1">no one could imagine,</para>

<para style="q1">these are the things that God has prepared for those who love him."</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="10" style="v" />These are the very things that God has shown us these things by the Spirit. For the Spirit sees everything and he knows everything. He even knows the deepest and hidden secrets that only God knows about himself. 

  <verse number="11" style="v" />No one except the spirit of the person knows what he is thinking. So it is that no one knows the hidden things of God except the Spirit of God.</para>

<verse number="12" style="v" />The Spirit that God gave us is not a spirit that comes from this world. We received the Spirit who comes from God. This Spirit helps us understand all the gifts God freely gives to us.

<verse number="13" style="v" />We teach these lessons that people schooled in the wisdom of this world cannot understand. These lessons are taught only by the Spirit of God. He helps us understand what these lessons mean.

<verse number="14" style="v" />The one who does not know God cannot accept the insights that come from the Spirit of God. To that person they sound like the lessons of fools. Only people who have the wisdom that comes from God can understand these things.

<verse number="15" style="v" />The one who knows God makes judgments about all matters, but he does not have to come under the judgment of other people. 

<verse number="16" style="v" />As one of our prophets wrote:

<para style="q1">"It is impossible for anyone to know all that is in the mind of the Lord.</para>

<para style="q1">No one is able to teach God."But we can know the very thoughts of Christ. </para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />My brothers and sisters, when I was with you, you were not ready to hear the difficult truths about God. I could speak to you only as if you were little children who are joined to Christ.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />I taught you things that were easy to understand, as a mother feeds milk to her babies. You were not ready for meat. And even now, you are not ready.</para>

<verse number="3" style="v" />Even though you are Christians, you are still acting as unbelievers. I know this, because many of you are jealous and quarreling with each other, and you are judging things just as if you were still unbelievers.

<verse number="4" style="v" />You are tearing the church into pieces, because some of you say you following what I, Paul, have taught; others say they are following what Apollos has taught. You are acting as unbelievers.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="5" style="v" />Compared to the great work that God has done in your lives, Apollos is not important. Neither is Paul important. We are both servants, and we serve the same God in the ways that he has assigned to us.</para>

<verse number="6" style="v" />Even though I was the first to plant the seed of God's word in you, it was Apollos who made sure you grew in faith. But it was God alone who can give spiritual growth to you.

<verse number="7" style="v" />Let me say it again: The ones who plant the seeds and water them, we do not matter in the least. God is the one who gives the growth. You are like a garden that he has planted.

<verse number="8" style="v" />The one who plants and the one who waters are working in the same job, and each one individually will receive a wage as a reward. The reward is the amount he is paid measured by how hard each one worked.  

<verse number="9" style="v" />We are working together with God and we both belong to God. But as for you, God is growing you in his field. It is as if he were building you up to become his dwelling.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="10" style="v" />God freely gave me a task to do for him. I worked among you like an expert builder with great care. But after me, someone else will build on what I began. Everyone builds on what others did before. But each one must be careful how they build. 

  <verse number="11" style="v" />For no other foundation can be laid other than the one that has already been set in place. That foundation is Jesus Christ.</para>

<verse number="12" style="v" />We are like builders who choose what to put on top of that foundation. Builders chose materials from among the gold, silver, precious stones, wood, hay, and straw.

<verse number="13" style="v" />God will judge our work and put on display what each of us has done for him. He will send fire to test the work we have done. That fire will also prove to God how hard we worked for him.

<verse number="14" style="v" />If a person's work survives the fire that tests what he built, he will receive a reward for his work.

<verse number="15" style="v" />But if the fire burns up all his work, he will lose all his reward, but God can still save him. Even though the flames completely devoured everything he did.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="16" style="v" />Surely you know that you are the dwelling place where God lives, that you are his temple. Surely you know that the Spirit of God lives inside of you.

  <verse number="17" style="v" />God promises that he will destroy anyone who attempts to destroy his temple. This is because his temple belongs to him alone. And he protects you by the same promise, because, you are now his temple and you belong to him alone!</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="18" style="v" />Be on guard that you do not deceive yourself. If any of you thinks he has great wisdom that unbelievers will admire, he should be careful. He would be far better off if he leaves alone all the things that unbelievers want, even if they consider him to be a fool for doing so. When he leaves those things alone, he will begin to learn what is true wisdom.

  <verse number="19" style="v" />What the world considers to be great wisdom, is really foolishness to God. For Scripture says, </para>

<para style="q1">"God catches the wise in their own foolish plans."

<verse number="20" style="v" />And again Scripture teaches, </para>

<para style="q1">"The Lord overhears all the planning of the wise, and he knows that in the end, they will lose everything."</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="21" style="v" />So stop admiring what unbelievers want, and stop being proud of doing those things. For God has given you all things. How does that compare to anything unbelievers can give you?

  <verse number="22" style="v" />God gave you Paul, and he gave you Apollos, and Peter. And God gave you this world, and your life, and his victory over death. And God gives you all that is and all that will be in the future—they are all yours;

  <verse number="23" style="v" />and you are Christ's; and Christ is God's. </para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />A person should consider us as servants of Christ, and as those to whom God entrusted the hidden truths in the Good News.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />We must faithfully do the work that God has given us to do because he trusts us to do it.</para>

<verse number="3" style="v" />If a human being, or even a court of law, judges my life, I think little about it. I am not able even to judge myself. 

<verse number="4" style="v" />I am not aware of anyone who accuses me of doing wrong. But that does not mean that I am innocent. It is the Lord who judges me.

<verse number="5" style="v" />So then, you should not judge anything before it is time. The Lord will do that when he returns. He is the one who can bring to light everything that is hidden even in total darkness, and he can make a right judgment because he knows what each person truly thinks. When he comes, every one will receive whatever honor they deserve from the Lord.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="6" style="v" />Now, brothers and sisters, the rule we follow is "do not go beyond what is written." Apollos and I live by it. For your sakes we teach only in this way. This keeps you thinking about the word God that you are learning. It keeps you from being too proud about the people who are teaching it to you, whether it is I or Apollos.

  <verse number="7" style="v" />There is no difference between you and any other believers. All of you have received everything as a gift. None of you is better than any other. None of you should boast like you are different from all the rest. We are all just the same.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="8" style="v" />But you act as if you have everything you want! You live as if you were rich! And you live as if you were reigning kings and queens—even without our help. Well, I wish you really had become kings queens, for then we could have ruled with you! 

  <verse number="9" style="v" />But in reality, it seems that God has put us apostles on display at the end of a line of prisoners being paraded after a battle. We are like men who have been sentenced to death, we have been put on display for the whole world to see, both angels and human beings.</para>

<verse number="10" style="v" />We apostles look to others like we are fools for Christ, and yet you see yourselves as wise people. We appear weak, but you seem to be the strong ones! You praise and honor yourselves, but we apostle are the ones who other people hate.

<verse number="11" style="v" />Up to this present time we apostles go around hungry and thirsty. We have been so poor we couldn't afford our own clothing. Officials have brutally beaten us again and again. We have no place to call our home.

<verse number="12" style="v" />We work with our hands to make a living. When others curse us, we bless them in return. When others make us suffer, we endure it. 

<verse number="13" style="v" />When people tell lies about us, we answer by being kind to them. And yet, they treat us like the garbage of the world and like the filth that people want to throw into a garbage heap.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="14" style="v" />I am not trying to shame you, but I want to correct you as a loving parent would correct a child.

  <verse number="15" style="v" />If you had ten thousand teachers telling you about Christ, you would still only have only one spiritual father. I became your father in Christ when you believed the Good News that I preached to you. 

  <verse number="16" style="v" />So I urge you to follow my example.</para>

<verse number="17" style="v" />That is why I sent Timothy to you. I love him, and he is my faithful child. He will remind you of how I live as I am joined to Christ. I teach the same things everywhere we go and in every church we visit. 

<para style="p">

  <verse number="18" style="v" />Some of you have become proud. You live as though I might not come back to you soon. </para>

<verse number="19" style="v" />But if the Lord wants me to come, I will come to you soon. Then I will learn not only how these arrogant people talk, but I will find out whether they have God's power in them.

<verse number="20" style="v" />God's kingdom is not about what you say; it is about God's power.

<verse number="21" style="v" />What would you want me to do? Should I come to punish you with a rod, or should I come so you can see how much I love you by how gentle I am to you?

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />People have told us that there is someone in your church who is living in sexual immorality, a kind of immorality that even the unbelievers do not allow. A man has a lover who is his father's wife. 

  <verse number="2" style="v" />You have been so arrogant! Rather you should have wept over this sin, for this harms the whole church. You must put this man out of your church. </para>

<verse number="3" style="v" />I am not with you physically, but I am very concerned for you all, and I am with you in my spirit. And I have already judged the one who did this, just as if I were with you.

<verse number="4" style="v" />When you gather together for worship under the authority of the Lord Jesus, I am worshiping with you—and I have already judged this person. 

<verse number="5" style="v" />You should turn this man over to Satan, so that his physical body might be destroyed. We have the hope that God will still save him when the Lord returns.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="6" style="v" />It is not good that you are praising yourselves. Surely you know that evil is like yeast: a little yeast makes the whole loaf rise. 

  <verse number="7" style="v" />Sin is like that yeast. You must clean out the old yeast and throw it away so that it cannot affect the whole batch of dough. You are like  an unleavened batch of dough. As in the Passover Festival, the yeast must be kept away from the bread. For Christ is our Passover lamb: he became the sacrifice for us.

  <verse number="8" style="v" />So let us celebrate the Passover Festival, and let us follow all the rules of purification. We must throw out the old yeast, which stands for disobedience and wickedness, and we must celebrate the festival by obeying God and speaking truth to each other. If we do that, we will be like the bread that has no yeast.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="9" style="v" />I wrote to you, that you must not be with sexually immortal people. 

  <verse number="10" style="v" />Of course, I did not mean that you should not associate with unbelievers who are immoral, or who desire things that belong to others, or who seize things that belong to others, or who worship idols. You would have to leave this world to avoid all people like that. </para>

<verse number="11" style="v" />Instead, I mean that you are not to be close friends with a fellow believer who is living in sexual immorality. We must include other sins, such as greed, or idolatry, or one who is abusive in the way he talks to others, or a drunkard, or a swindler. You must not even eat with these people who claim to trust in Christ, yet they do these things terrible things.

<verse number="12" style="v" />For I have no obligation to judge those who are outside the church of Christ. Your duty is to judge the those who are in it.

<verse number="13" style="v" />God is the one who will judge those who are outside the church. The Scriptures command us,   

<para style="q1">"You must take away the evil person who is among you!"</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />When you have a dispute with another believer, you should not take that matter before a civil judge who is not a believer. Take the matter to fellow believers, whom God has set apart for himself.</para>

<verse number="2" style="v" />You should know that we who belong to God will judge the world. If you will judge the world one day, you should be able to settle matters that are less important.

<verse number="3" style="v" />You should know that you will judge angels! Certainly you are able to judge matters in this life.

<verse number="4" style="v" />And if you can settle matters that are important in this life, you should not find it necessary to hand off disputes between Christians to be settled by unbelievers.

<verse number="5" style="v" />I say this to show how you have failed in this matter. There certainly must be someone in the church who is wise enough to settle these disputes when these sort of cases come up between Christian brothers and sisters.

<verse number="6" style="v" />But instead, some believers among you accuse other believers in a civil court and you allow a judge who is an unbeliever to settle the matter!

<para style="p">

  <verse number="7" style="v" />When you have any disputes between one another, it means that you have not done what you should have done. Allow a brother or sister to take advantage of you rather than you take them to court.

  <verse number="8" style="v" />Instead, you have wronged and cheated others, and the ones you cheated are your own brothers and sisters.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="9" style="v" />Surely you understand that God will never accept to rule over those who are wicked. Do not believe them when they tell you otherwise. The truth is that the sexually immoral, those who worship anything or anyone other than God, those who break their marriage vows, those who engage in perverse acts of so-called worship involving sex, and those who engage in the practice of homosexuality,

  <verse number="10" style="v" />those who steal, the ones who are greedy for more, those who get drunk, the ones tell lies about others, and those who steal from others who trust in them—God will never agree to rule over them.</para>

<verse number="11" style="v" />Some of you used to do these things. But God has made you clean from your sins, he has set you apart for himself, and he has made you right with himself. He has done all this through the power of the Lord Jesus Christ and the Spirit of our God.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="12" style="v" />Some say this: "I am free to do anything I want, because I joined to Christ." Yes, but because something is permitted does not mean it is good for me. "I am free to do anything I want"—but I will not allow anything to become my master.

  <verse number="13" style="v" />People also say, "Food is made for a person to eat, and a person is made to eat food"—but God will soon do away with both food and people. Of course, these people are really talking about sex. However, God did not make our bodies so we could be sexually immoral. But the body is to serve the Lord, and the Lord will provide for the body.  </para>

<verse number="14" style="v" />God raised the Lord from the dead, and he will also raise us up by his power to live again.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="15" style="v" />You should know that your bodies are joined to Christ. Should you take away that which is a part of Christ and join it together with a prostitute? Never! </para>

<verse number="16" style="v" />You understand that anyone who sleeps with a prostitute becomes united with her. It is like the Scriptures say about marriage: "The two will become one."

<verse number="17" style="v" />And those who are joined to the Lord becomes one spirit with him.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="18" style="v" />So when you want to commit a sexual sin, run away from it as quickly as you can! People say, "Every sin that a person commits is committed outside the body"—except that when one sins sexually, he sins against his own body. </para>

<verse number="19" style="v" />You should know that your body is a dwelling place, a temple of the Holy Spirit within you. God gave you his Spirit and now you no longer belong to yourself. Instead, you belong to God.

<verse number="20" style="v" />God purchased you with the price his Son's life. Therefore honor God in the all you do in your human body.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />You wrote to me some questions about how married believers should live. Here is my answer. There may be times in which it is good to abstain from sexual relations in marriage. 

  <verse number="2" style="v" />But people are tempted very often to be sexually immoral. So each husband should have his own wife, and each wife should have her own husband.</para>

<verse number="3" style="v" />And each married believer should have the right to have sexual relations with his or her spouse.

<verse number="4" style="v" />For the husband gives control of his body to his wife. And the wife gives control of her body to her husband.

<verse number="5" style="v" />So do not deprive one another of sexual intimacy, unless you both agree to set it aside for a short period of time, so that you may pray. But after that time is over, come together again. Do not allow Satan to tempt you because you cannot control yourself.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="6" style="v" />I am not commanding you to get married, but I know that many of you are married or will wish to marry. 

  <verse number="7" style="v" />My example is before you: I am single, and sometimes I wish that each of you were single in order to serve God. But God gives many different gifts to his children; he makes some able to be married, and others to remain single.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="8" style="v" />To those of you who have never married and those whose husbands have died, I say that it would be good if you continue to be single, like me. 

  <verse number="9" style="v" />But if it is hard for you to control yourself, you should get married. It is better for you to marry than to suffer from strong sexual desires.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="10" style="v" />The Lord gives his own commands to you who are married:  "The wife should not separate from her husband." 

  <verse number="11" style="v" />(But if she separates from her husband, she should not marry again, or else she should make peace with her husband.) And, "the husband should not divorce his wife." These are the commands of the Lord. </para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="12" style="v" />And I have this to say—and this is my advice, not the Lord's command—to you who have a wife who is not a believer: if she is content to stay with you, do not divorce her.

  <verse number="13" style="v" />And if you are a woman with a husband who does not believe, and if he is content to stay with you, do not divorce him.

  <verse number="14" style="v" />The unbelieving husband is set apart in a special way because of the wife trusts in God. It is the same for an unbelieving woman with a husband who trusts in God. It is the same for your children: they are set apart in a special way to God, because one parent believes in Christ.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="15" style="v" />However, if the unbelieving spouse wants to leave you, you should let that person go. In this situation, the vow you took when you married is no longer binding on you. God has called us to peace.

  <verse number="16" style="v" />You do not know how God may work through the life you live before your unbelieving spouse. And you do not know whether your life may become a means by which God might save your husband or your wife.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="17" style="v" />We must live the life the Lord has assigned us to live, and to obey the call God gave us. This is the principle in all the churches.

  <verse number="18" style="v" />If a man was circumcised before he became a Christian, he should not try to remove those marks. If you were not circumcised when God saved you, you should not let anyone circumcise you.

  <verse number="19" style="v" />Circumcision or uncircumcision—these are not important to us. But what is important is that we obey what God commands us to do.

  <verse number="20" style="v" />So continue to live and work as you did when God called you to trust in Christ. </para>

<verse number="21" style="v" />If you were a slave when God saved you, do not worry about it. Of course, if you have the chance to buy your freedom, take advantage of it and become free. 

<verse number="22" style="v" />This is because anyone who the Lord calls a slave is a free person because of the Lord. In the same way, you become God's slave when he calls you, even if you were never a slave to anyone.

<verse number="23" style="v" />God bought you with the price of his Son; your freedom is precious. So do not become slaves of humans.

<verse number="24" style="v" />Brothers and sisters in Christ, whatever you were when God called you, whether you were slave or free, remain in that same position.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="25" style="v" />Regarding the question about those who have never married, I will give my views, but I have no specific commandment from the Lord on this question. But you can have confidence in my reply because, by the Lord's mercy, he confirms my trustworthiness in these matters.

  <verse number="26" style="v" />Therefore, because of the difficult times that seem to be coming upon us all, I think it is good for you to remain as you where when God called you.</para>

<verse number="27" style="v" />To you who are married, I say: do not seek to be freed from your vow.

<verse number="28" style="v" />But to the men who are single, I say, if you marry, you have committed no sin. I give the same advice to the single women: if you get  married, you have committed no sin. However, if you marry, you will find many troubles, so I advise you to remain single.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="29" style="v" />This is what I mean about the time in which we are living, brothers and sisters: we have a short amount of time left. From now on those who are married will have to live as though they were not married, because of all the trouble that is coming. 

  <verse number="30" style="v" />Those who are filled with grief should not shed a tear. Those who rejoiced over some wonderful event, should have no joy on their faces or in their hearts. Those who spent money to buy something they wanted, should take no delight in it; they should live as if they owned nothing.

  <verse number="31" style="v" />And those who deal with unbelievers should live as if they had nothing to do with them anymore. For this world system is about to crumble into nothing.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="32" style="v" />I want you to be free from things to worry about. As you see, the unmarried man is concerned about the matters the are important to the Lord. He wants to serve the Lord and do what he wants. 

  <verse number="33" style="v" />But the man who is married must also concern himself for the day-to-day matters of the world as well as serving and pleasing his wife. 

  <verse number="34" style="v" />Those who are married have two kinds of concern that are pulling against each other. It is the same with widows and girls who have not married: as believing women, they are concerned to spend their time serving the Lord. They are thinking about how to live in the way that God has set them apart for himself. But married women are also concerned about the matters of the world that touch everyone else also. And in addition to that concern, they also want to please their husbands. </para>

<verse number="35" style="v" />I tell you this to help you. I do not want to give you any command. If you follow my advice, you will find it easier to serve the Lord without worrying about things that married people worry about.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="36" style="v" />If a man has promised to marry a woman, but if he finds he is not treating her with respect because of his sexual desires, he should get married. This is not a sin.

  <verse number="37" style="v" />But if he has decided that he does not desire to marry at the present time, and if he can control his sexual desires, he makes a good decision not to marry.

  <verse number="38" style="v" />So the one who marries his fiancée does a good thing and does not sin; and the one who chooses not to marry also chooses something even better.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="39" style="v" />A woman must remain with her husband as long as he lives; if her husband dies, she is free to marry whomever she wishes, but she must marry only someone who has faith in the Lord. 

  <verse number="40" style="v" />However, it is my judgment that a widow will be happier if she does not marry again. And I think that I, too, have the Spirit of God.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Now, about the question you asked regarding eating food that was offered to idols: We know that people say, "We all have knowledge." But if you think you know a lot, you can become very proud of yourself. If, however, when you love others, you help them grow strong in their faith.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />The truth is that if someone thinks he knows something, he has not yet learned the things he needs to know.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />When you love God, God knows you. </para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="4" style="v" />Now about eating food sacrified to idols: Let us begin with the principle that idols in this world are nothing. We have no doubt that "there is only one God." So idols are not real gods, they are not living gods at all.  

  <verse number="5" style="v" />Those many so-called gods and lords have temples, and people worship them as though they where alive in the heavens or on the earth.

  <verse number="6" style="v" />Scripture says this clearly, </para>

<para style="q1">"Yet for us there is one God, the Father,</para>

<para style="q1">from him come all things, and for him we live.</para>

<para style="q1">And there is only one Lord, Jesus Christ; </para>

<para style="q1">he made everything there is, and he is the one who gives us life.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="7" style="v" />But not everyone knows this.  Some worshiped an idol in earlier times, and, now, if they ate food sacrificed to an idol, they worry that they are still worshiping a god. They were torn between two opinions, they were weak in their faith in Christ, but they felt they were honoring an idol when they bought food that had been offered to it.</para>

<verse number="8" style="v" />We know that the food we eat doesn't make us better or worse before God. 

<verse number="9" style="v" />But what is important is your brother and sister in Christ. You are free to eat that food, but you should not cause a person to fall down in their faith because you have the freedom to eat it. 

<verse number="10" style="v" />You know that idols were never alive, nor were they gods at all. But if a weak brother sees you eating in an idol's temple, would that not encourage them to turn back to his dolatry?

<verse number="11" style="v" />As a result, if your weaker brother or sister sees you eat meat offered to idols because you have freedom in your mind to eat that food but they did not have the same freedom—your freedom to eat that food could destroy your brother or sister for whom Christ died. 

<verse number="12" style="v" />So, you sin against your weaker brothers and sisters when you encourage them to do something that their sense of right and wrong tells them not to do. This is sinning against Christ.

<verse number="13" style="v" />Therefore, if food causes my brother or sister to fall down in their relationship with God, I will never eat meat again! I do not want to do anything that causes them to fall.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />To people who criticize how I work, I reply like this: I am an apostle. I have seen Jesus our Lord. I am free. You are the result of the work I did—you are my workmanship.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />Even if some others do not think I am a true apostle, I am a true apostle to you. By the Lord's stamp of approval, you are the proof that I am a true apostle.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="3" style="v" />This is how I answer those who say that I am not a true apostle because I do not live on money that you believers give me. 

  <verse number="4" style="v" />Of course we have the right to live on such money.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />We can certainly travel with a believing wife, like the other apostles do—like the Lord's brother and Cephas.

  <verse number="6" style="v" />No one made a rule that only Barnabas and I who must work to support ourselves.</para>

<verse number="7" style="v" />No soldiers serves in the army at his own expense. No one plants a vineyard without being able to eat the grapes or drink the wine. No one shepherds a flock and without drinking some of the milk that comes from the animals.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="8" style="v" />This is common sense. But the Law says this as well. 

  <verse number="9" style="v" />For the Law of Moses, "When an ox is treading out the grain, do not stop it from eating some of it." There is something else God is concerned about in this law. 

  <verse number="10" style="v" />This law is about us. Moses is saying that those who work for in any job should benefit from the fruit of that work, just like the ox eating the grain on which he is treading, just like an an apostle over his church.

  <verse number="11" style="v" />If we have sown the seed of the good news to you, is it too much for us to receive money from you in our support?</para>

<verse number="12" style="v" />If others received this kind of help from you, we have certainly proven that we deserve it even more. 

<para style="p">However, we have not accepted anything from you, even though we were entitled to it. Instead, we endure all kinds of hardships so that we do not make it more difficult for people to believe in the Good News about Christ.

  <verse number="13" style="v" />Certainly you know that those who helped carry out the sacrifices offered to God in the temple received some of those offerings for their own needs. They received some of the food offered to God. 

  <verse number="14" style="v" />In the same way, the Lord has commanded that those who proclaim the Good News are to receive their living wages from the Good News. They receive part of what is given to God for their needs.   </para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="15" style="v" />But I have not demanded this money for myself. And that it not why I am writing this to you now. I would rather die than for you to pay me. I will not demand this because I did not claim my right to be supported by you—my reason for boasting.

  <verse number="16" style="v" />If I proclaim the Good News, I am not doing anything for which I should boast. I must preach the Good News. I would grieve with many tears if I could do what God called me to do. 

  <verse number="17" style="v" />When I preach the Good News freely, I have a great reward. But even if I did not preach it freely, I would still have to do it, because God trusted me to do this work for him.

  <verse number="18" style="v" />So what is the reward that God gives me? It is that when I preach the Good News to people who do not support me, I offer it freely, without putting anyone under obligation to me. They receive the Good News without costing them any money, and I do not receive from them anything they owe me.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="19" style="v" />I am free from all obligations, and I owe nothing to anyone. No one owns me anything, but I am a servant to everyone, so that I might persuade more and more people to trust in Christ. 

  <verse number="20" style="v" />When working with Jewish people, I become like a Jew, so that I may win them to Christ. To those who are living under the Law (though I am not living my life by the Law's demands), I lived like they lived, in order that those living under the Law may trust in Christ like I have.</para>

<verse number="21" style="v" />When I am with those who are non-Jews, those who live apart from the Law of Moses, I became like them (though I myself am not outside God's law, and I am obedient to the law of Christ), so that I can persuade those apart from the Law to trust in Christ.

<verse number="22" style="v" />To those who are weak about rules and laws, I lived as they did, so I could persuade them to trust in Christ. I have lived under rules and many ways and with all kinds of people so that in any way God chooses to work, God will rescue some of them.

<verse number="23" style="v" />I do all this so I may proclaim the Good News about Christ, so that I will also experience the good things the Good News brings to us.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="24" style="v" />You know when people run in a race, they all run, but only one of them wins the prize. So you also should run to win the prize.

  <verse number="25" style="v" />Every athlete is careful in how he trains. They are running for a wreath that quickly perishes and fades away. But we are running so we might receive a wreath that will last forever.

  <verse number="26" style="v" />Therefore, in everything I do, I do it for a purpose. I do not waste my effort or exhaust myself by striking the air like a boxer who has no opponent.

  <verse number="27" style="v" />I discipline my body and I make it obey my commands. I do not want to preach the Good News to others and then lose my reward because I failed to fulfill what he commanded me to do.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />I want you to remember, brothers and sisters, that our Jewish ancestors were following God, who led them out of Egypt by means of a cloud during the day, and that they passed through the Red Sea on dry land.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />And as we have been baptized into Christ, so the Israelites were to follow Moses as he followed God in the cloud and across the sea.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />They all ate the manna that God gave them from heaven, 

  <verse number="4" style="v" />and they all drank the water given that God gave them when Moses struck the rock. The rock was Christ.</para>

<verse number="5" style="v" />But God was angry with most of them because they worshiped other gods and rebelled against him, so their dead bodies lay on the ground all across the wilderness.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="6" style="v" />Now these things were an example for us, so we would learn not to greatly desire evil things, as they did.</para>

<verse number="7" style="v" />Some of our ancestors also worshiped idols. As the scripture says, "The people sat down to eat and drink and then they rose up to dance wildly in a sexual way." 

<verse number="8" style="v" />Twenty-three thousand of our Jewish ancestors died in one day because of their sexual immorality.

<verse number="9" style="v" />Let us not test the authority of Christ by disobeying him, as some of our ancestors did, and poisonous snakes killed them.

<verse number="10" style="v" />Do not grumble about what God provides, as some our ancestors did, and an angel destroyed them.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="11" style="v" />Now these things happened to our ancestors; they were written so we could learn from them—we, who are living very close to when the world will end.

  <verse number="12" style="v" />And so the lesson is, be careful if you think you are strong and are standing strong, be very careful, because this is just when you may fall. 

  <verse number="13" style="v" />Every temptation is shared by us all, but God has given us his promise and he will not permit the temptation to be greater than your ability to fight against the sin. When the temptation comes, God will provide a way for you to get free of it, so you may endure the temptation to sin.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="14" style="v" />Therefore, my loved ones, run away as fast as you can from idol worship.

  <verse number="15" style="v" />I speak to you as people who consider carefully how you live; think about what I am saying here.

  <verse number="16" style="v" />When we drink the cup of wine that we bless, we share in the blood of Christ. When we break the bread, we share in the body of Christ.

  <verse number="17" style="v" />There is only one loaf of bread, and we, although we are many, all make up just one body together, and we all take and eat from the one loaf of bread together.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="18" style="v" />Think about the people of Israel. Those who eat the sacrifices at the altar share in the altar.

  <verse number="19" style="v" />So am I saying that an idol is something real, or that it is important not to eat food sacrificed to an idol? Not at all. </para>

<verse number="20" style="v" />But I am saying this: when non-Jews make their sacrifices, they are really making them to demons, and not to God at all. And I do not wish that you share anything with demons.

<verse number="21" style="v" />You must not drink from the Lord's cup and then later drink the cup of demons.  You must not share in the Lord's supper and then later eat a meal with demons.

<verse number="22" style="v" />To do so would provoke the Lord to become jealous. You are not stronger than he is!

<para style="p">

  <verse number="23" style="v" />Some say, "Everything is lawful," but not everything is for our good or for the good of other people. Yes, "everything is lawful," but not everything helps people to grow strong in their life with God.  

  <verse number="24" style="v" />Do not work for your good only, but also for the good of other people. All of us must act toward everyone is such a way as to help them all.</para>

<verse number="25" style="v" />Here is our rule: you may buy whatever meat you want in the market without having to ask whether it was sacrificed to idols or not.

<verse number="26" style="v" />As the psalmist says, "The earth is the Lord's and everything in it."

<verse number="27" style="v" />If a non-Jewish unbeliever invites you to a meal, and you desire to go and eat whatever he serves you. You are not under any obligation to ask him about where he purchased the food.

<verse number="28" style="v" />But if someone says to you, "We bought this food at the idol temple and it was sacrificed to the gods," then do not eat the food, for the good of the person who served it, and so as not to cause conflict in the sense of right and wrong. 

<verse number="29" style="v" />This is not being careful about how you yourself think about right and wrong, but about how that other person thinks about it. My personal choices are not to be changed by what another person believes is right or wrong. 

<verse number="30" style="v" />If I enjoy the meal with thanksgiving, I should not permit someone else to condemn me.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="31" style="v" />The rule here is that whether you eat a meal or drink something offered to you, or whatever you do, do everything in a way so that you give praise to God. 

  <verse number="32" style="v" />Do not be offensive to Jews or to Greeks, nor even to those in the church of God, about matters such as these.

  <verse number="33" style="v" />I make it my duty to please everyone I can, in every way that is possible. I do this by not seeking my own good. Instead, I try to build up other people by helping them, so that God might save them.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Follow my example, just like I follow the example of Christ.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="2" style="v" />I praise you because you remember me in all you do, and you hold tight to all the important teachings that I have passed down to you and you have kept them just as I taught them to you.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />I want you to understand that Christ has authority over every man, and that a man has authority over a woman, and that God has authority over Christ. 

  <verse number="4" style="v" />So if any man covers his head when he prays or when he proclaims a message from God, he brings disgrace on himself.</para>

<verse number="5" style="v" />But if a woman prays or proclaims a message God gave her, with her head uncovered, she brings disgrace on herself. For it is exactly the same as if she had shaved her head.

<verse number="6" style="v" />If a woman refuses to cover her head, then she should cut her hair short, like a man's. But you know that it is disgraceful for a woman to have her hair cut short or to have her head shaved. So, instead, she should cover her head.
<verse number="7" style="v" />A man should not cover his head because God made him like himself, with a nature similar to his own. But women are the glory of men.

<verse number="9" style="v" />It was not the man whom God created for the help of the woman, but the woman for the man.

<verse number="10" style="v" />This is why women should cover their heads, as a sign of the authority of the man over her, and because of the angels.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="11" style="v" />So, in the Lord, the woman needs the help of the man, and the man needs the help of the woman. 

  <verse number="12" style="v" />The woman was made from the man and the man is born from the woman. They are dependent on one another. But all things come from God.</para>

<verse number="13" style="v" />Judge this for yourselves: Is it proper for a woman to pray to God without a cover on her head?

<verse number="14" style="v" />The laws of nature teach us that it is a disgrace for a man to have long hair,

<verse number="15" style="v" />but they also teach that long hair for a woman is a display of her beauty. Her hair is given to her by God to cover her beauty.

<verse number="16" style="v" />But if anyone in the church wishes to argue about this matter, we do not have any other custom than this, nor do any of the churches do anything different.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="17" style="v" />In these instructions, I cannot praise you for what you are doing about the Lord's supper. When you come together to eat, instead of encouraging and helping one another, you make the fellowship in the church much worse. 

  <verse number="18" style="v" />The first matter of concern is that when you come together, you come with different groups and factions. From what people have told me, this seems to be the truth. 

  <verse number="19" style="v" />It appears that you have different groups among yourselves, some are approved and have places of honor, and others are not. </para>

<verse number="20" style="v" />When you come together you are not eating the Lord's supper.  

<verse number="21" style="v" />When you eat, one person brings an entire meal and eats it as soon as he arrives; he does not wait for anyone else. Another person goes hungry while other people drink so much wine that they get drunk.

<verse number="22" style="v" />You act as though you didn't have houses to eat and drink in! You treat the church with dishonor, and you despise the purpose for which you gather. You humiliate those who are poor. I can say nothing good about this. This is a disgrace.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="23" style="v" />For I have passed on to you what I received from the Lord, that on the night when the Lord Jesus was handed over to his enemies, he took bread,

  <verse number="24" style="v" />and after he had given thanks, he broke it and said, "This is my body, which is for you, do this and remember me."</para>

<verse number="25" style="v" />After the same manner, he took the cup, after they had eaten, and said, "This cup is the new covenant in my blood. Do this as often as you drink it, remember me." 

<verse number="26" style="v" />For every time you eat this bread and drink this cup, you proclaim the death of the Lord until he  comes again.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="27" style="v" />All who come to this celebration of the Lord's supper should come to give honor to God in the way it is shared. Those who eat the bread and drink the cup must do so in a manner that honors the Lord. Anyone who dishonors the bread and the cup will be guilty of a sin against the body and blood of the Lord.  

  <verse number="28" style="v" />Therefore we should all examine ourselves before we take the communion. We should only eat the bread and drink the cup after we have examined our lives, our sins, and God's mercy.

  <verse number="29" style="v" />Anyone who eats and drinks this Suppoer and does not consider that he is handling the Lord's body, eats and drinks the judgment of God on himself. 

  <verse number="30" style="v" />Many among you are physically ill, and several have even died  because of the way you have treated the Lord's Supper.</para>

<verse number="31" style="v" />If we examine ourselves before we take the communion, God will not judge us.

<verse number="32" style="v" />But when the Lord judges and punishes us, he disciplines us to correct us, so that he will not condemn us along with the world that has rebelled against God.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="33" style="v" />When you come together for the Lord's supper, wait for one another. 

  <verse number="34" style="v" />If one of you is hungry, eat at home—so that when you come together as the church, it will not be an occasion for God to discipline you.  </para>

<para style="p">And when I come to you, I will give you instructions concerning the other matters you wrote me about.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />And now let me teach you about spiritual gifts, brothers and sisters. I want you to know how to use them. 

  <verse number="2" style="v" />You may recall how, when you worshiped idols—idols that could not even speak word—but still they led you astray. 

  <verse number="3" style="v" />The Spirit of God helps you declare, "Jesus Christ is Lord." No one who is filled with the Holy Spirit would ever say "May Jesus be accursed!"   </para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="4" style="v" />The Spirit gives many different gifts to the people of Christ, but he is the same Spirit.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />There are also many different ways to serve God, but only one Lord.

  <verse number="6" style="v" />There are also many ways to difficult jobs in God's kingdom, but it is God who gives the power his people need to labor for him. </para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="7" style="v" />The Spirit brings into plain view the gifts he gives, so that all who worship God and serve Christ, all of you, will make each other stronger and build each other up. 

  <verse number="8" style="v" />For the Spirit give the gift to one person who speaks a message with great wisdom from God, and to another person he gives the ability to speak a message using knowledge that he has taught. These different gifts come through the work of the same Spirit in each one who believes in Christ. </para>

<verse number="9" style="v" />And to another believer the Spirit gives the gift of trusting God for wonderful things. And another person he gives the ability to pray for God to heal people. The Spirit gives a variety of gifts, but he is still the same Spirit of God. 

<verse number="10" style="v" />And to another Christian the Spirit gives the ability to work miracles so that people will praise God. And to another, the gift of speaking messages from God. And to another, the Spirit gives various kinds of languages, and to others the interpretation of those messages into our language. 

<verse number="11" style="v" />Again and again we see the many different gifts, but the one Spirit gives these gifts to individuals and he gives these gifts as he chooses.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="12" style="v" />As the human body is a union of many parts, and every part of the body makes the whole, so it is with Christ. 

  <verse number="13" style="v" />For it is by the Spirit of Christ that, when we were baptized, we were each joined togethers into the body of Christ. It made no difference what our background was, either Jew or Greek, slave or free, but each of us received the gift of the Holy Spirit.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="14" style="v" />Remember, the body is not just one part, but many parts working together to make up the entire body. 

  <verse number="15" style="v" />If your foot spoke to you and said, "I am not the hand, therefore, I am not part of your body," it would not be less a part of your body because it wasn't like your hand.

  <verse number="16" style="v" />And if your ear said to you, "I am not an eye, therefore, I have no place in the body," it would not be less a part of your body because it wasn't an eye. 

  <verse number="17" style="v" />If your whole body were an eye, you could not hear anything. If your whole body were just one big organ to let you hear, you would hear nothing.</para>

<verse number="18" style="v" />But God fitted each part of the body together, and it works just as he designed it. Every part is needed. 

<verse number="19" style="v" />If each of us were exactly like all the other parts, we would not have a body at all. 

<verse number="20" style="v" />We are all many members, but only one body.

<verse number="21" style="v" />In your body, the eye cannot say to the hand, "I don't need you," it surely does need the hand. Nor would the head say to the feet, "I don't need you." 

<verse number="22" style="v" />Even the parts that are less capable or those that do necessary and mundane tasks, are all still essential to the body as a whole. 

<verse number="23" style="v" />The parts that are less presentable, we treat them with more honor by covering them,

<verse number="24" style="v" />but God has joined the distinguished parts with the less important ones. And God gives honor to those less presentable parts, because they are part of the body.

<verse number="25" style="v" />God honors the entire body in this way so there is no division in the church, and that members of the body of Christ might care for every member of the body with the same affection, no matter what their purpose or role, gifting or abililties.

<verse number="26" style="v" />Because we are one body, when one member suffers, we all suffer. When one member is given honor for something they accomplished for Christ, the entire body rejoices together.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="27" style="v" />Now you are the body of Christ, and individually, you are all members of it. </para>

<verse number="28" style="v" />God has also given people as gifts to the church. He gave to the church first apostles, second, prophets, third teachers, then those who do miracles, those who perform healing, those who provide helps, those who do work of administration, and those who have various kinds of languages that the Spirit has given them. Those are the gifts God gave you, gifts of people who are members of the the local church. God gave them to you. 

<verse number="29" style="v" />Not everyone is an apostle. Not all are prophets. Only some of us are teachers. Only some do miracles.

<verse number="30" style="v" />Can all of us heal the sick? Certainly not. Can all of us speak in special languages? Only some have that gift. Can all of us interpret messages into other languages? Only some can. We are all different in the gifts we have from God. 

<verse number="31" style="v" />But I want you to eagerly seek after the greater gifts, especially those gifts that encourage and strengthen the church. And now, I will show you a more excellent way.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />If I could speak so that I could amaze and persuade people to do what I wanted, or if I could speak with angels— but if I did not love people, I would be worth less than a gong or a cymbal, which does nothing but make noise. 

  <verse number="2" style="v" />If I could proclaim messages for God, and if I could explain secret truths about God, and if I trusted in God so much that I could move a mountain—but if I did not love people, I would be worth nothing.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />If gave away all I own to feed the poor, or if I sacrificed myself to be burned to rescue someone else—but if I do not love people, I would gain nothing.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="4" style="v" />If you truly love others, you will endure hardships with joy. If you truly love, you will be kind to others. If you truly love, you will not resent that other people possess things you do not have. If you truly love, you will not boast about yourself or be proud. 

  <verse number="5" style="v" />If you truly love others, you will not abuse them. You will not live to please yourself. No one will be able to make you angry quickly. You will not keep track of the wrong things people have done. </para>

<verse number="6" style="v" />If you truly love others, you will not be happy if anyone does wicked things; instead, you will be happy when people are faithful to God.

<verse number="7" style="v" />If you truly love others, you will put up with everything that happens. You will trust that God will do the best things for people. You will trust in God regardless of what happens. You will obey God regardless of what hardships you are facing.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="8" style="v" />If you truly love, you will not stop loving. Those who are able to speak God's messages, speak in strange language, or know hidden truths, do these things imperfectly. 

  <verse number="9" style="v" />Now, in this life, we know only a small part of all there is to know. Those who proclaim God's messages do so only partially.  

  <verse number="10" style="v" />But when things that are perfect happen, everything that is partial or incomplete will end.</para>

<verse number="11" style="v" />When I was a small child, I talked like a child talks, I thought like a child thinks, and I made decisions like a child. But when I became an adult, I stopped acting like a child, and I started acting like an adult.

<verse number="12" style="v" />What we understand about God now, we understand very imperfectly, not well at all. But when Christ returns, we will see him face to face. Now we know only part of what is true. But then we will know him fully, just as he knows us fully.

<verse number="13" style="v" />It is important that we trust in Christ now. It is important that we trust that he will do for us everything that he has promised. And it is important that we love him and each other. But the most impoFaith, hope, and love, these are the three virtues we need. But there is one that is the greatest among the three. As important as faith is, and regardless how much we value hope, still, the greatest is love.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />You must ask God earnestly to give you ability to strengthen your fellow believers with gifts of the Spirit; ask him especially to make you able to proclaim his messages.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />When a person speaks in a language given by the Spirit, he is not speaking to people, because no one can understand him, but he is speaking to God. He is saying things that we cannot understand, as the Spirit leads him.</para>

<verse number="3" style="v" />On the other hand, the prophet who proclaims the messages from God speaks directly to people. He does this in order to help them by making them stronger, to help them be unshakable, and to give them comfort so they can be happy even in hardship.

<verse number="4" style="v" />A person who speaks  in a language given by the Spirit builds himself up and give himself help, but a person who proclaims the messages of God builds up everyone and helps everyone in the church to be stronger in their faith.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="5" style="v" />Now I wish that all of you spoke in such languages, but it would be far better for the entire church, if more and more of you had the gift of speaking God's messages.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="6" style="v" />If I come to you and am only speaking in languages given by the Spirit, how can that help you, unless I speak to you and help you know matters that were hidden from you, or by helping you understand facts you do not know, or by proclaiming to you some message you have not heard before, or teaching some precept you had not learned.</para>

<verse number="7" style="v" />If I played the flute or harp—and they are not living beings, unlike people, and if the flute sounded no different from the harp, no one would be able to tell which instrument I was playing.

<verse number="8" style="v" />And if a soldier blew the trumpet poorly, the army would not know whether to get ready for battle.

<verse number="9" style="v" />This is what it is like when you say words that no one can understand: no one will know what you have said.

<verse number="10" style="v" />There are certainly many languages in the world, and all of them give meaning to those who understand them.

<verse number="11" style="v" />But if I do not understand someone's language, I will be like a foreigner to him, and he will be like one to me.

<verse number="12" style="v" />So it is important that people understand what you are saying. Try to do the things that encourage the believers in the church to trust Christ and obey him.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="13" style="v" />For that reason, pray that God will enable you to interpret what he says in a language that God has given him.

  <verse number="14" style="v" />If anyone prays in such a language, his spirit certainly prays, but his mind does not.</para>

<verse number="15" style="v" />Therefore, we should pray with our spirit, but also pray with our mind. And it is the same if we sing praise to God.

<verse number="16" style="v" />If you insist on praising God only in your spirit, the outsider will never understand what you are saying, and will never be able to agree with the message.

<verse number="17" style="v" />For if you give thanks in your spirit, that is well and good for you, but you are not helping the other believers.

<verse number="18" style="v" />I thank God that I speak in tongues more than any of you do.

<verse number="19" style="v" />But to the church I would rather speak five words with my mind, words with which I can teach others, than say ten thousand words in a language that God gives me.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="20" style="v" />Brothers and sisters, you should be like children who do not commit many kinds of sin. But when you think about yourselves and God, you should think well, and not like children. 

  <verse number="21" style="v" />In the Law it is written that God says, </para>

<para style="q1">"I will speak to my people Israel</para>

<para style="q1">by foreigners, men who speak in strange languages;</para>

<para style="q1">and my people will not understand me."</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="22" style="v" />So if a believer speaks in a language that God has given him, this impresses the unbelievers who might be listening. But if a believer speaks a message from God, this impresses the other believers. 

  <verse number="23" style="v" />You can seen how confusing it would be if everyone spoke in different languages that God had given them. Any unbeliever who heard them would call them all crazy.</para>

<verse number="24" style="v" />But if you were all taking turns speaking true messages from God, any unbeliever would realize that he was guilty of sinning against God.

<verse number="25" style="v" />God would tell the others there what this unbeliever was truly thinking. He would fall down with his face to the ground in wonder and fright, and he would praise God and say taht God was truly with you.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="26" style="v" />It should be this way when you worship God together. Each of you should come with a psalm to sing, or something to teach from the Scriptures, or something that God has told you, or with a message in a language that God has given, or with an interpretation of such a message. Everything you do together should encourage each other, for you are Christ's church.

  <verse number="27" style="v" />If there are any who wish to speak a message in a language from God, there should be no more than two or three such persons. They should speak one at a time, and someone should interpret the messages.

  <verse number="28" style="v" />However, if there is no able to interpret those messages, then those who speak in languages from God should keep silent and speak only to God.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="29" style="v" />If there are any who want to speak a message from God, there should be only two or three such persons; and everyone else should judge those message according to what the Scriptures say.

  <verse number="30" style="v" />But if God allows someone seated in the assembly to understand a message, then the one speaking the message should stop speaking. In this way, all the believers can listen to the meaning of the message.</para>

<verse number="31" style="v" />For each of those who proclaim the messages of God should do so. But they must do so one by one, in order, so that all the believers and can learn and receive courage to love God better. 

<verse number="32" style="v" />For those who truly speak God's messages control the spirit in which they do so.

<verse number="33" style="v" />For God does not create confusion; instead, he makes peace.

<para style="p">This is what we do in all the churches of those whom God has set apart for himself:

  <verse number="34" style="v" />let the women keep silent in church; they are not permitted to speak. They must not interrupt the one who is speaking God's message, but they should always obey their husbands, as also the Law says.

  <verse number="35" style="v" />When women want to learn, instead of interrupting the worship, they should speak with their husbands at home. It dishonors her husband for a woman to interrrupt the service.

  <verse number="36" style="v" />Where you the people by whom God gave us his word? Or are you the only ones to whom it came?</para>

<verse number="37" style="v" />If there is any prophet or any who is spiritual among you, he will understand that the things I write are what the Lord has commanded, and he will follow what I have written. 

<verse number="38" style="v" />But if anyone does not acknowledge what I have written, you should not acknowledge him.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="39" style="v" />So, my brothers, with earnest desire to speak God's messages to the church; and do not forbid anyone from speaking in languages that God gives.

  <verse number="40" style="v" />All that you do in the worship of the church, should be done with decorum and in proper order. </para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />And now I wish to remind you, brothers and sisters, about the Good News I proclaimed to you. You believed this message and now you live according to it.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />This Good News saved you, as long as you hold firmly to it—unless you did not truly believe it.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="3" style="v" />For I have passed on to you what others first told me, that Christ died for our sins, as the Scripture foretold he would; 

  <verse number="4" style="v" />also that they buried him, and that God raised him to life on the third day, all in conformity with what the Scriptures said would happen.</para>

<verse number="5" style="v" />Then Christ appeared to Cephas (known as Peter), and then he appeared to the rest of the apostles. 

<verse number="6" style="v" />He later appeared to more than five hundred brothers and sisters in the Lord when they were all together. Some of them have since died, but most are still alive and can verify this.

<verse number="7" style="v" />Then he appeared to James, and then again to all the apostles.

<verse number="8" style="v" />Last of all he appeared to me, although I did not at all deserve it. 

<verse number="9" style="v" />For I am the least of the apostles. I do not deserve to be an apostle, because I made the church of Christ suffer so greatly.

<verse number="10" style="v" />But God has been very kind to me, so he did many good things through me. Really, I have worked harder than all the other apostles. Still, it was not really I who worked, but God, who gave me the strength.

<verse number="11" style="v" />So whether it is the other apostles or I who preached to you, we proclaimed the Good News about Christ, and you believed us.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="12" style="v" />Now some of you are saying that those who are now dead will not rise anymore. This cannot be true, because we have announced to you that Christ rose from the dead.

  <verse number="13" style="v" />If no one rises from the dead, then God certainly has not raised Christ. 

  <verse number="14" style="v" />And if he has not raised Christ from the dead, then what we preach makes no sense at all, and what you believe about Christ can do nothing for you in your life or in your death. </para>

<verse number="15" style="v" />In addition, people will see that we have told lies about God, if the dead really do not rise again.

<verse number="16" style="v" />Again I say, if no one rises from the dead, then God has not even raised Christ.

<verse number="17" style="v" />And if he has not raised Christ, then what you believe is useless, and God still condemns you because you have sinned.

<verse number="18" style="v" />If that is the case, then all those who have died trusting in Christ have also died with no hope of resurrection.

<verse number="19" style="v" />If in this life only we have hope in Christ, and we expect him to do nothing for us after we die, then of all people, we most deserve the pity of others, for we have believed in a lie.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="20" style="v" />But in fact, God has raised Christ from the dead, and he is only the first of the many people that he will raise.

  <verse number="21" style="v" />For everyone in the world dies because of what  Adam did. However, those who have died will live again—also because of what a person has done, that is the man Christ Jesus.</para>

<verse number="22" style="v" />Because, just as all die because Adam sinned, in the same way, all will live again because of Christ has done.

<verse number="23" style="v" />But they will rise from the dead in a certain order: Christ is the first to have risen from the dead; then those who are joined to Christ will live again when he returns to earth.

<verse number="24" style="v" />Then the world will come to an end, when Christ will present all the world to God the Father, for him to rule. This is when Christ will bring to an end all who have the status of rulers, and everything that has reigning authority and all seats of power in this world.

<verse number="25" style="v" />For Christ must rule until God has conquered every one of his enemies, and placed them under Christ's feet to show that they have no more power. 

<verse number="26" style="v" />The final enemy that God will destroy is death itself.

<verse number="27" style="v" />For the Scriptures say, "God has placed everything under his feet," that is, Christ's feet. But it is clear that this does not include God himself.

<verse number="28" style="v" />After God has placed all things into Christ's power, then the Son, also, will place himself in the power of God the Father, so that God may be the same in relation to everyone and everything.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="29" style="v" />If all this were not true, then why do some Christians get others to baptize them for dead people? This would make no sense, if God will not raise the dead again.

  <verse number="30" style="v" />And it would make no sense for us apostles to continually risk our lives to proclaim the Good News.</para>

<verse number="31" style="v" />My brothers and sisters, I am so proud of you; you are like my possessions that I show off to Christ Jesus our Lord. But I tell you that it is as I died every day!

<verse number="32" style="v" />If God will not raise the dead, then I fought with those wild animals at Ephesus for nothing. What the poets wrote would in that case be true: "Let us eat food and drink wine today, because we will die tomorrow."
