<verse number="33" style="v" />Do not be tricked: "If you have bad friends, you will not care to live any longer in the right way."

<verse number="34" style="v" />Sober up! Live in the right way and do not keep sinning. Some of you do not know God at all. I say this to shame you.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="35" style="v" />Someone may ask you, "How can the dead rise? What kind of body could they ever have?"

  <verse number="36" style="v" />You know nothing! You do not think about the fact that any seed you plant in the ground will not start to grow until it dies. </para>

<verse number="37" style="v" />And when you die, the body you plant is not the same body that will come up. It is only a bare seed; it will change into something entirely different.

<verse number="38" style="v" />God will give it a new body just as he chooses, and to each seed put into the ground, he will give a different body.

<verse number="39" style="v" />Not all living creatures are the same. There are human beings, and there are animals on the land of many kinds, and there are the birds and fish. All of them are different.

<verse number="40" style="v" />There are also different kinds of things in the heavens. The nature of those heavenly bodies is different from the nature of the earthly things. 

<verse number="41" style="v" />There is one kind of the nature for the bright sun, and another kind for the softer moon. There is still another kind of nature for the stars, but the stars all differ one from another in many ways.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="42" style="v" />It is the same way when people rise from the dead. What goes into the ground has died, but what rises will never die again.

  <verse number="43" style="v" />When it goes into the ground, it has shame, but when God raises it again, it has honor and power.

  <verse number="44" style="v" />What goes into the ground belongs to this earth, but what rises from the dead has God's power. So, there are things that belong to this earth, and there are things that have God's power, which lasts forever.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="45" style="v" />So the Scriptures say, "The first man, Adam, was a living being who gave his children and descendants life." But Christ, the second Adam, gave people God's power to live forever.

  <verse number="46" style="v" />What belongs to the earth came first, the natural, and then came what belongs to God, that is the spiritual. </para>

<verse number="47" style="v" />The first man, Adam, belonged to the earth, for he was made of the dust. But the second man, Christ, belongs to heaven. 

<verse number="48" style="v" />Just as Adam was made from the dust, so are all those who come from him are made from the dust. It is just as Christ, who is the man from heaven: those who belong to heaven are made like him. 

<verse number="49" style="v" />Just as God made us like the man who was made from dust, so he will also make us be like the man from heaven.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="50" style="v" />Now I say this, brothers and sisters, human beings who will die cannot obtain the things that God promises to give all those whom he rules. It is just as the things that die cannot become things that do not die.

  <verse number="51" style="v" />Look! I tell you something that God has hidden from us. Not all believers will die, but God will change all of us. </para>

<verse number="52" style="v" />He will change us in an instant, as fast as one can blink his eye, when God's angels blow the final trumpet sound. For they will blow that  trumpet and then God will raise the dead so as to never die again.

<verse number="53" style="v" />For we, even if we all die, will live forever, never to die again. Yes, our bodies that are destined for death, God will make new, never to die again.

<verse number="54" style="v" />When this happens, then it will come true, what the Scriptures say:

<para style="q1">"God has totally defeated death."

<verse number="55" style="v" /></para>

<para style="q1">"Death will never win again!</para>

<para style="q1">The pain of dying has been taken away!"</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="56" style="v" />It is sin that brings such pain to us when we are dying. And sin's power comes into our lives because of the Law.

  <verse number="57" style="v" />But now we thank God because he gives us victory over death through our Lord Jesus Christ!</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="58" style="v" />Therefore, my dear brothers and sisters, be solid in your faith, unmoveable in your life, doing more and more in the Lord's work. You know that whatever you do for him will last forever..</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Now I wish to answer your questions about the money we are collecting. You should do exactly what I told the believers in their churches in Galatia to do.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />Every Sunday, each of you should put some money aside, as you are able, so you will not need any more collections when I come. </para>

<verse number="3" style="v" />You must choose people, whomever you wish, to take your gifts to Jerusalem. And when I arrive, I will send letters with them about your gift. 

<verse number="4" style="v" />If it is the right thing to do, they will travel together with me to Jerusalem.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="5" style="v" />I am planning to come to you when I travel through the region of Macedonia. 

  <verse number="6" style="v" />Perhaps I will stay with you, and perhaps all  through the winter, so that you can help me along the way in my trip. </para>

<verse number="7" style="v" />I do not want to see you for only a short time. I hope that the time will be long enough to help us both.

<verse number="8" style="v" />I want to stay in Ephesus until the Festival of Pentecost, 

<verse number="9" style="v" />because the Lord has opened a door for me there, although there are still many who oppose us.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="10" style="v" />Now when Timothy comes, treat him kindly and see to it that he has nothing to be afraid of, for he is doing the Lord's work, just like I am doing. 

  <verse number="11" style="v" />Do not let anyone be unkind to him. Help him on his way as much as you can; send him away in peace so that he may join me. I am expecting him to travel with other brothers who are coming my way. </para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="12" style="v" />You asked about our brother Apollos. I urged him strongly that he should visit you when the other brothers came to you. He decided not to come now, but he will come to you later when he has opportunity.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="13" style="v" />Be on guard, do not wander from your faith. Work for the Lord like grown men, and be strong.

  <verse number="14" style="v" />Do everything through the power of love.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="15" style="v" />You know the people in the house of Stephanas, that they were the first ones in the province of Achaia to believe, and they are determined to help those who belong to the Lord. I urge you, brothers and sisters, 

  <verse number="16" style="v" />obey people like them who help in the work, and who work hard with us.</para>

<verse number="17" style="v" />I was glad when Stephanas, Fortunatus, and Achaicus arrived here from Corinth, because they made up for the fact that you were not here.

<verse number="18" style="v" />They encouraged and helped me in my spirit, as they helped you as well. Tell others about much how they helped you.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="19" style="v" />The churches in Asia send greetings. Aquila and Prisca send you greetings as you do the work of the Lord, and the other believers that meet in their home do so as well.

  <verse number="20" style="v" />The rest of the brothers and sisters greet you, too. Greet one another with a kiss of affection. </para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="21" style="v" />I, Paul, am writing this sentence with my own hand.

  <verse number="22" style="v" />If anyone does not love the Lord, let a curse be on him. O Lord, come!

  <verse number="23" style="v" />May the kindness that comes from the Lord Jesus be with you. 

  <verse number="24" style="v" />I send you this reminder that I love all of you, as you all are joined together in Christ Jesus. Amen.</para>
